definitions: particular skill or area in which someone excels or performs best
musical direction indicating passage should be played loudly and forcefully
examples: Public speaking has always been her forte in business presentations
Mathematics was never his forte despite years of tutoring
The orchestra played the forte section with impressive power
The composer marked forte at the climax of the symphony

definitions: number that comes after thirty-ninth in a sequence or position
celebration or marker of forty years since a particular event
examples: She finished fortieth in the marathon despite her injury
The fortieth page contained the crucial evidence
They celebrated their fortieth wedding anniversary with a cruise
The company's fortieth year brought record profits

definitions: military defensive structure built to protect against enemy attack
process of making something stronger or more resistant to attack
addition of nutrients to food products to improve nutritional value
examples: Ancient fortifications surrounded the medieval city walls
The army built temporary fortifications along the border
The fortification of the harbor took months to complete
Fortification against cyber attacks requires constant vigilance
Vitamin D fortification of milk helps prevent deficiency diseases
The fortification of flour with iron reduces anemia rates

definitions: courage and strength of mind that enables a person to endure adversity with courage
examples: She faced her illness with remarkable fortitude and grace
The survivors showed incredible fortitude during their ordeal
His fortitude in the face of criticism inspired his teammates
Developing fortitude requires experiencing and overcoming challenges

definitions: period of fourteen days or two weeks commonly used in British English
examples: They planned to return from vacation in a fortnight
The project deadline was set for a fortnight hence
She visited her grandmother every fortnight without fail
The magazine publishes new issues once a fortnight

definitions: large amount of money or valuable possessions accumulated over time
chance or luck as an arbitrary force affecting human affairs
prediction of future events supposedly revealed through divination
examples: He amassed a fortune through real estate investments
The family fortune disappeared during the economic crash
By good fortune, she found her lost passport at the airport
Fortune smiled upon them when they won the lottery
The psychic claimed to read fortunes using tarot cards
She had her fortune told at the carnival tent

definitions: number equal to four times ten in the decimal counting system
examples: The temperature reached forty degrees Celsius during the heatwave
She invited forty guests to her birthday celebration
Forty students enrolled in the advanced chemistry course
The biblical flood lasted forty days and forty nights

definitions: place or medium where ideas and views can be exchanged
online message board where users discuss topics of interest
public square in ancient Roman cities used for business and assemblies
examples: The university hosted a forum on climate change policy
The town hall served as a forum for community concerns
She posted her question on the technical support forum
The gaming forum attracted thousands of daily users
Tourists visited the ruins of the Roman Forum in Italy
The ancient forum served as the center of civic life

definitions: service of sending mail from one address to another destination
process of transmitting data packets between network segments
examples: She arranged mail forwarding before moving to her new apartment
The forwarding service ensures important documents reach you
Email forwarding automatically sends messages to multiple accounts
Port forwarding allows remote access to local network services

definitions: preserved remains or traces of ancient organisms found in sedimentary rock
person or thing that is outdated or resistant to change
examples: The museum displayed fossils from the Jurassic period
Scientists discovered fossil evidence of early human ancestors
That old fossil still uses a typewriter instead of computers
His management style is a fossil from the 1950s

definitions: temporary care of children in one's home as foster parents
act of encouraging or promoting the development of something
examples: They specialized in fostering teenagers with behavioral challenges
The agency handles fostering placements for vulnerable children
The program focuses on fostering creativity in young artists
Fostering innovation requires a supportive corporate culture

definitions: violation of rules in sports resulting in a penalty
extremely unpleasant or offensive smell, taste, or substance
examples: The referee called a foul for unnecessary roughness
She committed three fouls in the first quarter
A foul odor emanated from the garbage disposal
The detective noticed a foul substance on the floor

definitions: lowest load-bearing part of a building that transfers weight to ground
institution established to provide funding for charitable purposes
cosmetic cream or powder applied as base layer of makeup
underlying basis or principle on which something is established
examples: The foundation cracked during the earthquake causing structural damage
Workers poured concrete for the foundation of the new building
The Gates Foundation funds global health initiatives worldwide
She established a foundation to support arts education
She applied foundation to even out her skin tone
The makeup artist recommended a lighter foundation shade
Trust forms the foundation of any successful relationship
Mathematical foundations are essential for advanced physics

definitions: person who establishes an institution, business, or organization
act of a ship filling with water and sinking
examples: The company founder started the business in his garage
She was the founder of three successful tech startups
The vessel began to founder in the stormy seas
Many ships have foundered on those dangerous rocks

definitions: act of establishing or creating an institution, organization, or settlement
examples: The founding of the university dates back to 1850
They celebrated the founding of their company annually
The founding fathers drafted the constitution with great care
The founding members established the club's bylaws

definitions: infant or young child abandoned by parents and discovered by others
examples: The foundling was raised by the monks who discovered him
Victorian novels often featured foundlings as main characters
The foundling hospital cared for abandoned babies in the 1800s
She discovered she was a foundling when researching her ancestry

definitions: workshop or factory where metal is melted and cast into specific shapes
examples: The iron foundry produced parts for industrial machinery
Workers at the foundry wore protective gear against molten metal
The bell was cast at a specialized bronze foundry
The foundry operated three furnaces twenty-four hours daily

definitions: decorative structure that shoots water into the air for display
original source from which something flows or originates abundantly
examples: The marble fountain sparkled in the plaza's center
Children threw coins into the fountain for good luck
The library was a fountain of knowledge for researchers
She seemed to be a fountain of creative ideas

definitions: original source or spring from which a stream flows or something originates
examples: The small spring was the fountainhead of the mighty river
They traced the contamination to its fountainhead
Ancient Greece is considered the fountainhead of Western philosophy
The research institute became a fountainhead of innovation

definitions: number that is one more than three in the counting sequence
examples: The table has four legs for maximum stability
She owns four cats and two dogs
The meeting is scheduled for four o'clock this afternoon
A car typically has four wheels

definitions: group of four people or things, especially for social or sporting activities
examples: The golf foursome teed off at dawn for their round
They formed a regular bridge foursome every Thursday
The dinner reservation was made for a foursome
The musical foursome performed jazz standards at the club

definitions: number equal to ten plus four in the decimal counting system
examples: She will turn fourteen on her next birthday
The recipe calls for fourteen ounces of chocolate
Fourteen students qualified for the state competition
The journey took fourteen hours by train

definitions: number that comes after thirteenth in a sequence or order
reference to the Fourteenth Amendment of the US Constitution
examples: February fourteenth is Valentine's Day in many countries
She finished fourteenth in the swimming competition
The Fourteenth Amendment guarantees equal protection under law
Lawyers cited the Fourteenth Amendment in their argument

definitions: position number four in a sequence or ranking
musical interval spanning four scale degrees
one of four equal parts into which something is divided
examples: She came in fourth place in the race
The fourth chapter explains the main theory
The perfect fourth creates a consonant harmony
She played fourths on the piano for practice
He ate a fourth of the pizza by himself
The company lost a fourth of its value

definitions: domestic bird kept for eggs or meat such as chickens or ducks
wild bird hunted for sport or food, especially waterfowl
examples: The farmer raised various fowl including chickens and geese
Domestic fowl provide both eggs and meat
Hunters pursued waterfowl during the autumn migration
Wild fowl nested in the marsh wetlands

definitions: person who hunts wild fowl, especially using nets or traps
examples: The fowler set his nets before dawn to catch migrating birds
Medieval fowlers supplied game birds to noble households
Professional fowlers understood bird migration patterns thoroughly
The fowler's decoys attracted ducks to the hunting blind

definitions: small wild carnivorous mammal with reddish fur and bushy tail
person who is cunning, attractive, or cleverly deceptive
fur from a fox used in clothing and accessories
examples: The red fox hunted mice in the meadow at twilight
Urban foxes have adapted to city environments
That old fox outsmarted all his business competitors
She's a real fox with her striking appearance
Her grandmother's fox stole was stored in the attic
The coat had a fox fur collar

definitions: type of grass with brushy seed heads resembling a fox's tail
bushy tail of a fox
examples: Foxtail grass can be harmful to dogs if seeds get lodged
The meadow was covered with golden foxtail in autumn
The fox's foxtail helped it balance while running
The distinctive foxtail marked it as a red fox

definitions: ballroom dance in 4/4 time with slow-slow-quick-quick rhythm
letter F in the NATO phonetic alphabet used in radio communication
examples: They learned the foxtrot for their wedding reception dance
The band played a smooth foxtrot for the older couples
The pilot used 'Foxtrot' to indicate the letter F
In military communications, Foxtrot represents the sixth letter

definitions: entrance hall or lobby in a house, theater, or hotel
examples: Guests gathered in the theater foyer during intermission
The hotel foyer featured marble floors and crystal chandeliers
She decorated the foyer with fresh flowers weekly
The foyer connected the entrance to the main living areas

definitions: hydraulic fracturing process to extract oil and gas from underground rock formations
examples: Fracking operations increased natural gas production significantly
Environmental groups protested against fracking near water sources
The fracking process involves high-pressure water and chemicals
Several states banned fracking due to environmental concerns

definitions: complex geometric pattern that repeats at every scale and produces self-similar shapes
examples: The mathematician studied fractal patterns in nature
Computer graphics use fractals to generate realistic landscapes
Coastlines exhibit fractal properties when examined closely
The fractal design created intricate and beautiful patterns

definitions: numerical quantity that is not a whole number expressed as quotient
small or tiny part, amount, or proportion of something
examples: Students learned to add fractions with different denominators
The fraction three-fourths equals zero point seven five
She completed the marathon in a fraction of her usual time
Only a fraction of applicants were accepted

definitions: process of separating a mixture into its component parts through distillation or other methods
examples: Oil refineries use fractionation to separate crude oil components
The fractionation column operated at different temperature levels
Blood fractionation produces various plasma proteins for medical use
Chemical fractionation isolated the active compounds

definitions: break or crack in a bone caused by injury or disease
break or crack in hard material or surface
examples: The X-ray revealed a hairline fracture in her wrist
The fracture required six weeks in a cast to heal
The earthquake caused fractures in the building's foundation
Stress fractures appeared in the metal after repeated use

definitions: quality of being easily broken or damaged physically
state of being weak, vulnerable, or delicate emotionally or structurally
examples: The fragility of the antique glass required careful handling
Bubble wrap protected items of extreme fragility
The economic fragility became apparent during the crisis
Her emotional fragility worried her close friends

definitions: small piece broken off or detached from something larger
incomplete or isolated portion of something
examples: Archaeologists found pottery fragments at the dig site
Glass fragments scattered across the floor after the accident
She could only remember fragments of the conversation
The manuscript contained fragments of ancient texts

definitions: process of breaking into smaller pieces or fragments
state of being divided into disconnected or incomplete parts
examples: Habitat fragmentation threatens many wildlife species
The bomb caused extensive fragmentation damage
Political fragmentation weakened the coalition government
Market fragmentation created opportunities for niche products

definitions: pleasant or sweet smell, especially from flowers or perfume
examples: The fragrance of roses filled the garden in spring
She selected a new fragrance at the perfume counter
The candle's vanilla fragrance created a cozy atmosphere
Natural fragrances are preferred in organic products

definitions: condition of being weak and delicate physically, especially due to age
moral weakness or susceptibility to temptation
examples: His increasing frailty required daily nursing care
The frailty of elderly patients demands gentle treatment
Human frailty leads to mistakes and poor judgment
She acknowledged her frailty in resisting temptation

definitions: rigid structure surrounding a picture, door, or window
basic structure of a person's body regarding size and shape
single complete image in a series of film or video images
set of beliefs or ideas used to interpret or understand something
examples: She chose an ornate gold frame for the painting
The door frame needed repair after years of use
His large frame made him perfect for football
Her petite frame belied her physical strength
The film runs at twenty-four frames per second
The animator drew each frame by hand
The new policy must be understood within a legal frame
They viewed the issue through different cultural frames

definitions: basic structure underlying or supporting a system or construction
essential supporting structure of ideas for a system or concept
examples: The steel framework supported the entire building structure
Workers assembled the framework for the new greenhouse
The legal framework governs international trade agreements
They developed a framework for evaluating student performance

definitions: process of constructing a building's structural frame
way of presenting or conceptualizing an issue or topic
act of making someone appear guilty of a crime they didn't commit
examples: The framing stage of construction took three weeks
Proper framing ensures the building's structural integrity
The media's framing of the story influenced public opinion
Careful framing of the question elicited better responses
The detective suspected someone was framing the suspect
Evidence of framing emerged during the investigation

definitions: former monetary unit of France and other countries before the euro
examples: The price was listed in French francs before the euro
She exchanged her francs for euros at the bank
Swiss francs remain a stable international currency
The old franc coins became collectors' items

definitions: license to sell products or services using another company's business model
constitutional or legal right to vote in elections
professional sports team that is member of a league
series of related films, books, or other media sharing characters
examples: She bought a fast food franchise in her hometown
The franchise agreement specified territorial rights
Universal franchise gave all adults the right to vote
Women gained the franchise after years of activism
The basketball franchise moved to a larger market
The franchise struggled financially despite fan support
The movie franchise generated billions in revenue
The franchise expanded to include books and games

definitions: official mark or signature on mail indicating postage has been paid
examples: The postal frank showed the letter was sent from London
Government mail often carries an official frank
The meter frank eliminated the need for stamps
Collectors value covers with historical franking marks

definitions: smoked sausage made of beef and pork traditionally associated with Frankfurt, Germany
examples: He grilled frankfurters for the backyard barbecue
The deli sold authentic German frankfurters
Street vendors served frankfurters with mustard and sauerkraut
Children enjoyed frankfurters at the baseball game

definitions: aromatic resin obtained from trees used in incense and perfumes since ancient times
examples: Frankincense was one of the gifts brought to baby Jesus
The church burned frankincense during the ceremony
Ancient traders transported frankincense along the spice route
Frankincense oil is used in aromatherapy treatments

definitions: informal term for fraternity, a social organization of male college students
examples: He joined a frat during his sophomore year
The frat house needed major repairs after the party
Frat members organized the campus charity drive
The frat brothers remained friends after graduation

definitions: social organization of male college students living together
group of people sharing common profession or interests
feeling of friendship and mutual support within a group
examples: The fraternity hosted rush week to recruit new members
His fraternity house overlooked the campus quad
The medical fraternity gathered for the annual conference
She joined a professional fraternity for women engineers
The fraternity among firefighters creates strong bonds
Military service develops a sense of fraternity
